relation: Virginia Beach, VAOcean Lakes Harold finished with 78 tackles, 16 sacks and 28 tackles during his senior season.
Ashburn, VABriar Woods Carter, who is a threat on offense, defense or special teams, was named his district’s defensive player of the year this fall.
Midlothian, VAClover Hill Only playing seven games because of a knee injury, Caleb still finished with 747 yards passing and 737 yards rushing this fall.
Norfolk, VANorfolk Christian School Moore, who will play in the Army All-American Bowl, helped lead his team to a state title game in Virginia.
Chesapeake, VAOscar Smith Despite missing three games with an ankle injury, Coleman has rushed for 1,312 yards and 17 touchdowns on 160 carries so far this season.
Chesterfield, VALloyd C Bird Clarke has already been named the player of the year in his district for the 2011 season.
Lynchburg, VABrookville Kirven had helped lead Brookville to an undefeated season through 11 games.
Clifton, VACentreville Ekanem could play linebacker or defensive end in college and has led his team on a deep playoff run.
Ringgold, VADan River Considered an outside linebacker recruit, Edmunds had two 200-plus yard rushing games in the playoffs as well.
Christchurch, VAChristchurch School Homer helped his team to an undefeated 10-0 season this fall.
Lorton, VASouth County Devin's brother, Ronny, is a red-shirt freshman at Virginia Tech.
Virginia Beach, VABayside Through the first ten games of his senior season, Cooper had 36 receptions for 813 yards and nine touchdowns.
Portsmouth, VAWoodrow Wilson Greene also played quarterback this fall, and plans to enroll in January at Virginia Tech.
Powhatan, VABlessed Sacrament Huguenot Conte was a big part of his teams 9-2 season this fall.
Richmond, VABenedictine School Williams was also able to show off his athleticism at tight end this fall, where he was equally effective in blocking and pass receiving.
Norfolk, VANorfolk Christian School Wynn was named first team All-Conference after his senior season.
Roanoke, VANorthside Jackson finished his senior season with 22 receptions for 360 yards, and added 34 tackles on defense.
Norfolk, VANorfolk Christian School Nixon finished with nine touchdown receptions this fall, and also became a major part of the defense at outside linebacker.
Virginia Beach, VAGreen Run Through his teams first ten games, Hall had over 70 tackles, 13 sacks and returned a blocked field goal for a touchdown.
Christiansburg, VAChristiansburg A high ankle sprain caused him to miss six games, but when healthy Motley led a potent offense at quarterback and anchored the defensive secondary.
Chester, VAThomas Dale In nine games this fall Frye had 97 tackles and three interceptions, while also chipping in with 16 receptions for 420 yards and four touchdowns.
Woodberry Forest, VAWoodberry Forest School Prosise ended his senior season with six interceptions, two fumble recoveries, and on spcial teams, five returns for touchdowns.
Richmond, VAHermitage Miles-Redmond helped anchor an offensive line that led the team to a 12-1 season.
Virginia Beach, VACox Smith is the son of former Virginia Tech and NFL legend, Bruce Smith.
Christchurch, VAChristchurch School Smith's play on the offensive line was a major part of his team's undefeated season this fall.
Richmond, VAVarina Chavis helped Varina to an 8-3 season this fall.
Hampton, VAPhoebus Deloatch will play in the U.S. versus The World game in Febuary.
Salem, VAGlenvar Known more for his defensive abilities, Dooley also rushed for 782 yards and 11 touchdowns in his teams first ten games.
Highland Springs, VAHighland Springs Wright was named first team All-District at running back after his senior season.
Chesapeake, VAOscar Smith Playing on a powerful Oscar Smith defense, Stallings has been a leader during their 13-1 season.
